newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Wafangdian to sell unit to parent firm.
newsitem.headline: Wafangdian to sell unit to parent firm.

text.p: China's largest bearing maker Wafangdian Bearing Co Ltd (WBC) said on Wednesday it would sell one of its subsidiaries to its largest shareholder and parent, Wafangdian Bearing Group Co Ltd.

WBC will sell a 45 percent stake in Dalian Guangyang Wazhou Automobile Bearing Co Ltd to Wafangdian Group, which held 200 million state shares, or 60.6 percent of WBC's 330 million outstanding shares at end-1996, WBC said in a statement in the Shenzhen-based Securities Times.
WBC's shareholders have already approved the move, but the sale has yet to be finalised, the statement said.
It gave no more details and company officials were not immediately available for comment.
WBC listed 130 million B shares on the Shenzhen bourse in March 1996. Sweden's AB SKF, one of the world's largest bearing makers, holds 50 percent of the B shares.
